data.title: 100 Notable Alumni of University of Groningen [Sorted List]
data.meta_description: Below is the list of 100 notable alumni from the University of Groningen sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff. 2 individuals affiliated with the University of Groningen won Nobel Prizes in Physics and Chemistry.
data.meta_site_name: EduRank.org - Discover university rankings by location
data.text:
100 Notable alumni of

University of Groningen

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

The University of Groningen is 396th in the world, 140th in Europe, and 4th in the Netherlands by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 100 notable alumni from the University of Groningen sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff. 2 individuals affiliated with the University of Groningen won Nobel Prizes in Physics and Chemistry.

Sahra Wagenknecht

Born in

Germany

Years

1969-.. (age 55)

Occupations

journalisteconomistpoliticiannon-fiction writer

Biography

Sahra Wagenknecht is a German politician, economist, author, and publicist. Since 2009 she has been a member of the Bundestag, where until 2023 she represented The Left. From 2015 to 2019, she served as that party's parliamentary co-chair. With a small team of allies, she left the party on 23 October 2023 to found her own party in 2024, Bündnis Sahra Wagenknecht, to contest elections onwards.

Pim Fortuyn

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1948-2002 (aged 54)

Occupations

university teachersociologistwriterprofessorcolumnist

Biography

Wilhelmus Simon Petrus Fortuijn, known as Pim Fortuyn, was a Dutch politician, author, civil servant, businessman, sociologist and academic who founded the party Pim Fortuyn List (Lijst Pim Fortuyn or LPF) in 2002.

Princess Christina of the Netherlands

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1947-2019 (aged 72)

Occupations

aristocratsinger

Biography

Princess Christina of the Netherlands was the youngest of four daughters of Queen Juliana of the Netherlands and Prince Bernhard of Lippe-Biesterfeld. She taught singing in New York and was a long-term supporter of the Youth Music Foundation in the Netherlands. Born visually impaired, she worked to share her knowledge of dance and sound therapy with the blind.

Aletta Jacobs

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1854-1929 (aged 75)

Occupations

peace activisteditorsuffragistwomen's rights activistphysician

Biography

Aletta Henriëtte Jacobs was a Dutch physician and women's suffrage activist. As the first woman officially to attend a Dutch university, she became one of the first female physicians in the Netherlands. In 1882, she founded the world's first birth control clinic and was a leader in both the Dutch and international women's movements. She led campaigns aimed at deregulating prostitution, improving women's working conditions, promoting peace and calling for women's right to vote.

Johan Huizinga

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1872-1945 (aged 73)

Occupations

historianuniversity teacherlinguistphilosopheranthropologist

Biography

Johan Huizinga was a Dutch historian and one of the founders of modern cultural history.

Arjen Lubach

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Occupations

television presenterscreenwriterrecord producerpresentercabaret performer

Biography

Arjen Henrik Lubach is a Dutch comedian, author, music producer and television presenter. Between 2014 and 2021 he was the host of the weekly news satire television show Zondag met Lubach. As of 21 February 2022, he is the host of a new show on NPO 1, De Avondshow met Arjen Lubach.

Frans de Waal

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

ethologistuniversity teacherprimatologistphotographerzoologist

Biography

Franciscus Bernardus Maria "Frans" de Waal is a Dutch primatologist and ethologist. He is the Charles Howard Candler Professor of Primate Behavior in the Department of Psychology at Emory University in Atlanta, Georgia, director of the Living Links Center at the Yerkes National Primate Research Center at Emory, and author of numerous books including Chimpanzee Politics (1982) and Our Inner Ape (2005). His research centers on primate social behavior, including conflict resolution, cooperation, inequity aversion, and food-sharing. He is a member of the United States National Academy of Sciences and the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences.

Heike Kamerlingh Onnes

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1853-1926 (aged 73)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied in 1870

Occupations

physicistuniversity teacherscientistinventorprofessor

Biography

Heike Kamerlingh Onnes was a Dutch physicist and Nobel laureate. He exploited the Hampson–Linde cycle to investigate how materials behave when cooled to nearly absolute zero and later to liquefy helium for the first time, in 1908. He also discovered superconductivity in 1911.

Epke Zonderland

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1986-.. (age 38)

Occupations

artistic gymnast

Biography

Epke Jan Zonderland is a Dutch artistic gymnast and the 2012 Olympic gold medallist on high bar. He is a 4-time Olympian (2008–20) and has also taken 3 World Championships golds on high bar at the 2013, 2014 and 2018 World Championships, the first man to secure this feat on that apparatus. He is nicknamed "The Flying Dutchman.”

Paul Polman

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1956-.. (age 68)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied in 1977

Occupations

entrepreneurwritereconomistinternational forum participantmanager

Biography

Paulus Gerardus Josephus Maria Polman, is a Dutch businessman and author. He was the chief executive officer (CEO) of the British/Dutch consumer goods company Unilever. Polman is also the author of Net Positive: How Courageous Companies Thrive by Giving More Than They Take.

Lara van Ruijven

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1992-2020 (aged 28)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied in 2011-2012

Occupations

short-track speed skaterspeed skater

Biography

Lara Victoria van Ruijven was a Dutch short track speed skater. At the 2018 Winter Olympics, she was part of the Dutch 3000 metres relay team that won a bronze medal. She won gold at the World Championships one year later. By doing so, she became the first Dutch woman to win a world short track title at an individual event.

Prince Bernhard of Orange-Nassau-Vollenhoven

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1969-.. (age 55)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

1989-1995 graduated with doctorandus in marketing and market research

Occupations

racing automobile driverentrepreneuraristocrat

Biography

Prince Bernhard Lucas Emmanuel of Orange-Nassau, van Vollenhoven is a Dutch entrepreneur and a member of the Dutch royal family.

Edgars Rinkēvičs

Born in

Latvia

Years

1973-.. (age 51)

Occupations

politiciandiplomat

Biography

Edgars Rinkēvičs is a Latvian public official and politician serving as the 11th and current president of Latvia since July 2023. He previously served as the minister of foreign affairs of Latvia from 2011 to 2023, and head of the Chancery of the President of Latvia as state secretary of the Ministry of Defence, as well as a deputy of the Saeima.

Wim Duisenberg

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1935-2005 (aged 70)

Occupations

politicianuniversity teacherbankereconomistprofessor

Biography

Willem Frederik "Wim" Duisenberg was a Dutch politician and economist who served as President of the European Central Bank from 1 June 1998 until 31 October 2003. He was a member of the Labour Party (PvdA).

Job Cohen

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1947-.. (age 77)

Occupations

university teacherpoliticianjurist

Biography

Marius Job Cohen is a retired Dutch politician and jurist who served as Mayor of Amsterdam from 2001 to 2010 and Leader of the Labour Party (PvdA) from 2010 to 2012.

Ben Feringa

Awards

Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2016

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied in 1969-1978

Occupations

chemistuniversity teacher

Biography

Bernard Lucas Feringa is a Dutch synthetic organic chemist, specializing in molecular nanotechnology and homogeneous catalysis. He is the Jacobus van 't Hoff Distinguished Professor of Molecular Sciences, at the Stratingh Institute for Chemistry, University of Groningen, Netherlands, and an Academy Professor of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences. He was awarded the 2016 Nobel Prize in Chemistry, together with Sir J. Fraser Stoddart and Jean-Pierre Sauvage, "for the design and synthesis of molecular machines".

Prince Maurits of Orange-Nassau-Vollenhoven

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

In 1995 graduated with Master of Science in economics

Occupations

aristocratbusinessperson

Biography

Prince Maurits Willem Pieter Hendrik of Orange-Nassau, van Vollenhoven is a member of the Dutch royal family as the eldest son of Princess Margriet of the Netherlands and Pieter van Vollenhoven.

Jan Hendrik Oort

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1900-1992 (aged 92)

Occupations

physicistastronomeruniversity teacherprofessor

Biography

Jan Hendrik Oort was a Dutch astronomer who made significant contributions to the understanding of the Milky Way and who was a pioneer in the field of radio astronomy. The New York Times called him "one of the century's foremost explorers of the universe"; the European Space Agency website describes him as "one of the greatest astronomers of the 20th century" and states that he "revolutionised astronomy through his ground-breaking discoveries." In 1955, Oort's name appeared in Life magazine's list of the 100 most famous living people. He has been described as "putting the Netherlands in the forefront of postwar astronomy."

Halbe Zijlstra

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1969-.. (age 55)

Occupations

international forum participantpolitician

Biography

Halbe Zijlstra is a retired Dutch politician who served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 26 October 2017 to 13 February 2018 in the Third Rutte cabinet. He is a member of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD).

Wubbo Ockels

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1946-2014 (aged 68)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied in 1973

1973-1978 graduated with Doctor

Occupations

university teacherphysicisttelevision presenterastronautaircraft pilot

Biography

Wubbo Johannes Ockels was a Dutch physicist and astronaut with the European Space Agency who, in 1985, became the first Dutch citizen in space when he flew on STS-61-A as a payload specialist. He later became professor of aerospace engineering at Delft University of Technology.

Tanja Nijmeijer

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1978-.. (age 46)

Occupations

partisanactivist

Biography

Tanja Nijmeijer, also known as Alexandra Nariño, is a Dutch former guerrilla fighter and English teacher who has been a member of the Colombian guerrilla group Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) since 2002. She has also been one of the group's leading public figures since the discovery of her diary in 2007. She was part of the negotiating team involved in successful peace talks with the Colombian government.

Sybrand van Haersma Buma

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1965-.. (age 59)

Occupations

politicianlawyerjurist

Biography

Sybrand van Haersma Buma is a Dutch politician serving as Mayor of Leeuwarden since 2019. Until 2019, he was a member of the House of Representatives from 2002 who also served as the parliamentary leader of the Christian Democratic Appeal (CDA) from 2010 and as the leader of his party from 2012.

Bruno Bruins

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1963-.. (age 61)

Occupations

international forum participantpolitician

Biography

Bruno Johannes Bruins is a Dutch politician of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD) who served as Minister for Medical Care in the Third Rutte cabinet from 26 October 2017 to 19 March 2020, when he resigned. He previously served as State Secretary for Education, Culture and Science from 29 June 2006 until 22 February 2007 in the Second and Third Balkenende cabinets.

Ernst Kuipers

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

1979-1986 studied medicine

Occupations

politiciangastroenterologist

Biography

Ernst Johan Kuipers is a Dutch gastroenterologist, professor and politician who served as Minister of Health, Welfare and Sport in the fourth Rutte cabinet from 2022 until 2024. He is a member of the Democrats 66 (D66) party.

Stef Blok

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1964-.. (age 60)

Occupations

bankerpolitician

Biography

Stephanus Abraham "Stef" Blok is a Dutch politician serving as Minister of Economic Affairs and Climate Policy in the Third Rutte cabinet from 25 May 2021 till 10 January 2022. He is a member of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD).

Johan Remkes

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Johannes Wijnandus "Johan" Remkes is a Dutch politician and nonprofit director who served as Deputy Prime Minister of the Netherlands from 2002 to 2003 under Prime Minister Jan Peter Balkenende. He is a member of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD).

Tommy Wieringa

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied history

Occupations

writerjournalist

Biography

Tommy Wieringa is a Dutch writer. He received the Ferdinand Bordewijk Prize in 2006 for his novel Joe Speedboot (2005), and the Libris Prize in 2013 for the novel Dit zijn de namen (2012). In 2018 he won the Bookspot Literatuurprijs for his novel De heilige Rita (The Blessed Rita). His novel The Death of Murat Idrissi, translated by Sam Garrett from Dutch, was nominated for the International Booker Prize in 2019.

Frits Zernike

Awards

Nobel Prize in Physics in 1953

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1888-1966 (aged 78)

Occupations

physicistuniversity teacherchemistinventormathematician

Biography

Frits Zernike was a Dutch physicist and winner of the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1953 for his invention of the phase-contrast microscope.

Renske Leijten

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied Dutch studies

Occupations

spokespersonpolitician

Biography

Renske Maria Leijten is a Dutch politician of the Socialist Party (SP), who was a member of the House of Representatives between 2006 and 2023.

Arie Slob

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1961-.. (age 63)

Occupations

historianpoliticianteacher

Biography

Arie Slob is a Dutch politician and history teacher who served as Minister for Primary and Secondary Education and Media in the Third Rutte cabinet from 26 October 2017 until 10 January 2022.

William Frederick, Prince of Nassau-Dietz

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1613-1664 (aged 51)

Occupations

politicianwriter

Biography

William Frederick, Count (from 1654 Imperial Prince) of Nassau-Dietz, Stadtholder of Friesland, Groningen and Drenthe.

Pieter Jelles Troelstra

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1860-1930 (aged 70)

Occupations

juristwriterpoet lawyerpoliticianlawyer

Biography

Pieter Jelles Troelstra was a Dutch lawyer, journalist and politician active in the socialist workers' movement. He is most remembered for his fight for universal suffrage and his failed call for revolution at the end of World War I. From 1888 to 1904, Troelstra was married to Sjoukje Bokma de Boer, a well-known children's book writer, under the pen name of Nienke van Hichtum.

Jetta Klijnsma

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1957-.. (age 67)

Occupations

politicianhistorian

Biography

Jellejetta "Jetta" Klijnsma is a Dutch politician serving as the King's Commissioner of Drenthe since 2017. She is a member of the Labour Party (PvdA).

Malik Azmani

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1976-.. (age 48)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Malik Azmani is a Dutch politician and former lawyer and civil servant. A member of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD), which he led in the 2019 European Parliament election, he has served as a Member of the European Parliament (MEP) since then. Azmani was first elected to the House of Representatives in 2010.

Willem de Sitter

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1872-1934 (aged 62)

Occupations

physicistastronomermathematicianuniversity teacher

Biography

Willem de Sitter was a Dutch mathematician, physicist, and astronomer.

Sofie van den Enk

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1980-.. (age 44)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied American studies

Occupations

authortelevision presenterpresenter

Biography

Sofie van den Enk is a Dutch television presenter who currently works for the KRO. Sofie graduated in 2006 from the University of Groningen and holds a master's degree in American Studies.

Heleen Mees

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Occupations

women's rights activistwriterlawyercolumnistjurist

Biography

Heleen Mees is a Dutch opinion writer, economist, and lawyer. Involved with politics and public policy in the Netherlands and the US, she has also taught at universities in both countries.

Princess Annette of Orange-Nassau, van Vollenhoven-Sekrève

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1972-.. (age 52)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

1991-1996 graduated with Master of Science in psychology

Occupations

aristocrat

Biography

Princess Annette of Orange-Nassau, van Vollenhoven-Sekrève is the wife of Prince Bernhard of Orange-Nassau, van Vollenhoven, the second son of Princess Margriet of the Netherlands and Pieter van Vollenhoven.

Stientje van Veldhoven

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1973-.. (age 51)

Occupations

politiciandiplomat

Biography

Stientje van Veldhoven-van der Meer is a Dutch politician serving as Minister for the Environment and Housing in the Third Rutte cabinet since 2019. A member of the Democrats 66 (D66) party, she served as State Secretary for Infrastructure and Water Management from 2017 to 2019.

Henk Bleker

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1953-.. (age 71)

Occupations

politicianjurist

Biography

Hinderk "Henk" Bleker is a retired Dutch politician and jurist who served as State Secretary for Economic Affairs, Agriculture and Innovation in the First Rutte cabinet from 14 October 2010 to 5 November 2012. A member of the Christian Democratic Appeal (CDA), he previously was party chair from 20 June 2010 until 14 October 2010.

Princess Marilène of Orange-Nassau

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

In 1994 studied business management

Occupations

aristocratbusinessperson

Biography

Princess Marilène of Orange-Nassau, van Vollenhoven-van den Broek is the wife of Prince Maurits of Orange-Nassau, van Vollenhoven, and was thereby member of the Dutch Royal House until King Willem-Alexander's accession in 2013 rendered Prince Maurits too distantly related to the reigning monarch. She remains a member of the larger Dutch royal family.

Klaas Knot

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Occupations

economistinternational forum participantuniversity teacherbanker

Biography

Klaas Henderikus Willem Knot is a Dutch economist and central banker who is the current President of the Dutch central bank De Nederlandsche Bank (DNB). In this capacity he serves as a member of the Governing Council of the European Central Bank (ECB), as well as of the Board of Governors of the International Monetary Fund (IMF). Knot also holds a position as Professor in Monetary Stability at the University of Amsterdam and honorary professor at the University of Groningen.

Kati Piri

Born in

Hungary

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Occupations

politicianpolitical adviser

Biography

Kati Piri is a Hungarian-born Dutch politician serving as a member of the House of Representatives since 2021. A member of the Labour Party (PvdA), she previously was a Member of the European Parliament (MEP) within the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats from 2014 until 2021.

Hans Wijers

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Occupations

economistpolitician

Biography

Gerardus Johannes "Hans" Wijers is a Dutch retired politician of the Democrats 66 (D66) party, and businessman. He is the chairman of the supervisory board of ING Group since 2018.

Menno Snel

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Occupations

economistbanker

Biography

Menno Snel is a Dutch politician. A member of the Democrats 66 (D66) party, he served as State Secretary for Finance from 26 October 2017 until his resignation on 18 December 2019.

Winnie Sorgdrager

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

politicianjudgelawyer

Biography

Winnifred "Winnie" Sorgdrager is a retired Dutch politician of the Democrats 66 (D66) party and jurist. She was granted the honorary title of Minister of State on 22 June 2018.

Sandra van Nieuwland

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1977-.. (age 47)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied in 2005

Occupations

singer

Biography

Sandra van Nieuwland, also known as Sandra Newland, is a Dutch singer who gained national popularity after her participation in the third season of The Voice of Holland.

Jacques Monasch

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1962-.. (age 62)

Occupations

economistpoliticianart collector

Biography

Jacques Simon Monasch is a Dutch politician, art collector and former management as well as political consultant and civil servant. He was a member of the House of Representatives between 17 June 2010 and 23 March 2017, where he focused on matters of housing and spatial planning. He was a member of the Labour Party from 1986 to 2016. Due to Monasch leaving the Labour Party, the Second Rutte cabinet lost its majority in the House of Representatives. Several weeks after leaving the Labour Party Monasch announced he would enter the 2017 general election with his new party, Nieuwe Wegen. His party did not obtain any seats in the election.

Alidius Tjarda van Starkenborgh Stachouwer

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1888-1978 (aged 90)

Occupations

diplomatpoliticianresistance fighter

Biography

Jonkheer Alidius Warmoldus Lambertus Tjarda van Starkenborgh Stachouwer was a Dutch nobleman and statesman, primarily noted for being the last colonial Governor-General of the Dutch East Indies, now Indonesia. He was taken captive after accepting Japan's demands for an unconditional surrender of the islands on 9 March 1942.

Willem Vermeend

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

university teacherlawyercolumnistjuristeconomist

Biography

Wilhelmus Adrianus Franciscus Gabriël "Willem" Vermeend is a retired Dutch politician of the Labour Party (PvdA), academic, author and businessman. His academic career has varied between specialising in tax law, European law, and digital economy. As an author, he has published over a dozen books. Subjects include politics and economics.

Ben Woldring

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1985-.. (age 39)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied in 2003-2005

2005-2007 studied art history

Occupations

Internet entrepreneur

Biography

Ben Woldring is a Dutch internet entrepreneur and millionaire from Usquert who first rose to fame in the autumn of 1998 when, for a school assignment, he made a website where consumers could compare prices for mobile phone services. As a result, he appeared on television programmes like Kassa and the Jeugdjournaal. In 1999, the website Bellen.com registered its 100,000th visitor; a year later, Woldring started the company Bencom B.V. and hired his mother as an employee. In 2003, he won Ernst & Young's Entrepreneur of the Year Award and on November 14, 2006, he was named the best European Entrepreneur under 25 by Business Week. He is also an ambassador for the Beatrix Kinderkliniek in Groningen and the Stichting voor het Gehandicapte Kind. As of September 2009, he owns 9 price comparison websites, with the hotel comparison site LookingforBooking.com as his most recent project.

Hilbrand Nawijn

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

singerpoliticianlawyer

Biography

Hilbrand Pier Anne Nawijn is a Dutch lawyer and politician of the local political party Lijst Hilbrand Nawijn (LHN) in Zoetermeer.

Wim Pijbes

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1961-.. (age 63)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied art history

Occupations

art historianwriter

Biography

Willem Meint Jans "Wim" Pijbes is a Dutch art historian and emeritus General Director of the Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam.

William Penney, Baron Penney

Years

1909-1991 (aged 82)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied in 1929-1930

Occupations

physicistpoliticianmathematician

Biography

William George Penney, Baron Penney, OM, KBE, FRS, FRSE was an English mathematician and professor of mathematical physics at the Imperial College London and later the rector of Imperial College London. He had a leading role in the development of High Explosive Research, Britain's clandestine nuclear programme that started in 1942 during the Second World War which produced the first British atomic bomb in 1952.

Henk Nijboer

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1983-.. (age 41)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied general economics

Occupations

economistpolitician

Biography

Henk Nijboer is a Dutch politician. As a member of the Labour Party (Partij van de Arbeid) he has been an MP since 20 September 2012. Previously he was a member of the provincial parliament of the province of Groningen from 2003 to 2007.

Ina Brouwer

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1950-.. (age 74)

Occupations

politicianlawyer

Biography

Ina Brouwer is a Dutch politician of the Communist Party of the Netherlands (CPN) and later co-founder of the GroenLinks (GL) party and lawyer.

Dirk Stikker

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1897-1979 (aged 82)

Occupations

bankerbadminton playerpoliticiandiplomat

Biography

Dirk Uipko Stikker was a Dutch politician and diplomat of the defunct Liberal State Party (LSP), co-founder of the defunct Freedom Party (PvdV) and of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD), and businessman. Stikker was known for his abilities as a manager and negotiator. Stikker continued to comment on political affairs as a statesman until his death. He holds the distinction as the first Secretary General of NATO from the Netherlands.

Frank de Grave

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1955-.. (age 69)

Occupations

bankerpolitician

Biography

Franciscus Hendrikus Gerardus "Frank" de Grave is a Dutch politician of the People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (VVD) and businessman. He is an Extraordinary Member of the Council of State since 3 September 2018.

Blanks

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1997-.. (age 27)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied information science

Occupations

YouTubermusician

Biography

Simon de Wit, known professionally as Blanks, is a Dutch musician and YouTuber. Beginning his music career as a YouTuber, he created his channel 'Music by Blanks' in 2013. His remakes of Bazzi's "Mine" and Post Malone's "Better Now" went viral in 2018 and became his breakthrough.

Jacques Wallage

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1946-.. (age 78)

Occupations

university teacherpoliticiansociologist

Biography

Jacques Wallage is a retired Dutch politician of the Labour Party (PvdA) and sociologist.

Rutger Kopland

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1934-2012 (aged 78)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

Studied medicine

Occupations

physician writerpoetpsychiatristuniversity teacher

Biography

Rutger Kopland was a Dutch poet who gained great popularity for his "accessible, thoughtful style, his mild irony, his sentimentality" and whose collections sold over 200,000 copies.

Farshad Bashir

Born in

Afghanistan

Years

1988-.. (age 36)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Farshad Bashir is a Dutch politician of Afghan descent. As a member of the Socialist Party (Socialistische Partij) he was an MP from 15 January 2008 to 23 March 2017. He focused on matters of taxation, traffic and water management.

Gerbrand Bakker

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1962-.. (age 62)

Occupations

writerjournalist

Biography

Gerbrand Bakker is a Dutch writer. He won the International Dublin Literary Award for The Twin, the English translation of his novel Boven is het stil, and the Independent Foreign Fiction Prize for The Detour, the English translation of his novel De omweg.

Balthasar Bekker

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1634-1698 (aged 64)

Occupations

writertheologianhead teacherChristian ministerphilosopher

Biography

Balthasar Bekker was a Dutch minister and author of philosophical and theological works. Opposing superstition, he was a key figure in the end of the witchcraft persecutions in early modern Europe. His best known work is De Betoverde Weereld (1691), or The World Bewitched (1695).

Fred de Graaf

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1950-.. (age 74)

Enrolled in the University of Groningen

1968-1975 studied public law and Law of the Netherlands

Occupations

politicianlawyerjurist

Peter van de Kamp

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1901-1995 (aged 94)

Occupations

astronomeruniversity teacher

Biography

Piet van de Kamp, known as Peter van de Kamp in the United States, was a Dutch astronomer who lived in the United States most of his life. He was professor of astronomy at Swarthmore College and director of the college's Sproul Observatory from 1937 until 1972. He specialized in astrometry, studying parallax and proper motions of stars. He came to public attention in the 1960s when he announced that Barnard's star had a planetary system based on observed "wobbles" in its motion, but this is now known to be false. On November 14, 2018, the Red Dots project announced that Barnard's star hosts an exoplanet at least 3.2 times as massive as Earth, though this does not match either of the planets he had claimed. In 2021, even this planet's existence was questioned.

W. R. van Hoëvell

Born in

Netherlands

Years

1812-1879 (aged 67)

Occupations

politicianwriterjudge

Biography

Wolter Robert Baron van Hoëvell was a Dutch minister, politician, reformer, and writer. Born into nobility and trained in the Dutch Reformed Church, he worked for eleven years as a minister in the Dutch East Indies. He led a Malay-speaking congregation, engaged in scholarly research and cultural activities, and became an outspoken critic of Dutch colonialism. His activism culminated when he acted as one of the leaders of a short-lived protest in 1848. During the event, a multi-ethnic group of Batavian inhabitants presented their grievances to the local government. As a result of his leadership in the protest, van Hoëvell was forced to resign his position in the Indies.

astronomer

Biography

Bartholomeus Jan "Bart" Bok was a Dutch-American astronomer, teacher, and lecturer. He is best known for his work on the structure and evolution of the Milky Way galaxy, and for the discovery of Bok globules, which are small, densely dark clouds of interstellar gas and dust that can be seen silhouetted against brighter backgrounds. Bok suggested that these globules may be in the process of contracting, before forming into stars.

Biography

Martin van Marum ( Dutch pronunciation: [ˈmɑrtɪn vɑn ˈmaːrʏm]; 20 March 1750, Delft – 26 December 1837, Haarlem) was a Dutch physician, inventor, scientist and teacher, who studied medicine and philosophy in Groningen. Van Marum introduced modern chemistry in the Netherlands after the theories of Lavoisier, and several scientific applications for general use. He became famous for his demonstrations with instruments, most notable the Large electricity machine, to show statical electricity and chemical experiments while curator for the Teylers Museum.

Biography

Marten "Martin" Zijlstra was a Dutch politician. He started his political career as member of the States of Groningen, serving between 1974 and 1978. Starting in 1977 he served as Mayor of Termunten for thirteen years. He was a member of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands between 1989 and 2002 for the Labour Party and focused on interior affairs and defence policy. After his time as Representative he served two stints as acting mayor in Oldambt and Schiermonnikoog.
